sn48.17:1.3: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
sn48.17:1.5: Someone who has completed and fulfilled these five faculties is a perfected one. If they are weaker than that, they’re one who is extinguished between one life and the next … one who is extinguished upon landing … one who is extinguished without extra effort … one who is extinguished with extra effort … one who heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm … a once-returner … a stream-enterer … a follower of the teachings … a follower by faith.
sn48.17:1.6: So, mendicants, if you practice fully you succeed fully. If you practice partially you succeed partially.
sn48.17:1.7: These five faculties are not a waste, I say.”
